course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Issues in Social Biology: from Diet to Diseases, DNA to Deforestation
course.class_descr: Issue In Soc BIO: Diet To Dise

notes.note: Prerequisite: previous course work in biology and sociology and health or a related area or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: An introductory biology course or permission of instructor. Two additional credits for students opting to take the 3 week intensive field trip.
Lecture 002 is the 5 credit option with the field trip.
Two field trips are required.
Prerequisites: An introductory course in Biology or Botany, or permission of instructor. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 3470.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Nutritional Quality Improvement of Food Crops

notes.note: Prerequisite: one majors-level biology course or permission of instructors.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: The GMO Debate: Science and Society

notes.note: Prerequisite: one year introductory biology or permission of instructor.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Concepts and Techniques in Plant Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 and BIOMG 3300 or BIOMG 3320, or equivalents. Recommended prerequisite: BIOMG 3310.

Prerequisite: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Arts students may not count this course toward graduation but may, upon petition (one time only) to their class dean, carry fewer than 12 other credits and remain in good standing. This would affect Dean's List eligibility but not eligibility for graduating with distinction. Students from all Colleges must submit a CALS Special Studies Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study). Do not sign into section 601. You will be put in the course after submitting form online.
Prerequisite: BIOMG 2800 or equivalent, BIOMG 3300 or BIOMG 3330 or BIOMG 3350 or BIOMG 3310 or equivalent, or permission of instructor.
Requirement for: graduate students doing work in plant biology.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Faculty Research in Plant Cell and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: graduate students or written permission from member of Plant Cell and Molecular Biology Program or from coordinator for undergraduates.
Enrollment limited to and required for: second-, third-, and fourth-year graduate students in Plant Biology.
Enrollment preference given to: graduate students who are working with faculty members on an individual basis. Sign into your faculty members section.
